title.rendered: Blockchain Economic Forum Taking Place in San Francisco

content.rendered:
The Blockchain Economic Forum (BEF) will take place in San Francisco from June 16 to June 20, 2018. There will be funds with $30+ billion in assets, two former ministers, and the CFTC chairman (under Obama’s presidency). Among other invited speakers is Mykyta Safronenko, Applicature regional director and panel moderator in Silicon Valley.

When/Where?

BEF San Francisco will start on Saturday, June 16, 2018 at 12:00 PM and last until Wednesday, June 20, 2018, at 1:00 AM. The forum will take place at the San Francisco Marriott Marquis, 780 Mission Street, San Francisco, CA. Tickets can be purchased here.

Who Are the Speakers?

The main speakers of the meeting will be:

  • Sophia (social humanoid robot)
  • Tim Draper (DFJ fund founder)
  • Joe Oliver (Minister of Finance, Canada)
  • Clair Brown (professor emeritus, University of California, Berkeley)
  • Valentin Preobrazhenskiy (Latoken founder)

BEF will feature more than 170 opinion leaders, more than 40 speakers and approximately 2,000 guests to discuss the current state of the blockchain economy and related challenges at roundtables and panels. Most attendees have been invited personally to ensure exceptional networking and investor relations.

What Is the Topic of Discussion?

The topic of the meeting will cover the current state and biggest challenges of blockchain economy:

  • Technology: graphchain transactions
  • Banking: smart-contract monetary policy execution
  • State of blockchain: state elections, court and budget issues
  • Regulations: the future of crypto regulations
  • Drivers: the future of cryptocurrency over fiat
  • CrossTech
  • Blockchain application and implementation
  • Media
  • Investments: the new era of VC

Applicature Speaker at Blockchain Economic Forum

Mykyta Safronenko is an Applicature regional director, and will be panel moderator of the events in Silicon Valley. Mykyta has been invited to be a speaker at the Blockchain Economic Forum.

He deals with business-development strategies and expands partnerships in the Applicature Blockchain Agency. He is an experienced specialist in ICOs, blockchain technologies, and smart-contract development.

Mykyta Safronenko graduated from San Francisco State University with a degree in Marketing, and also attended Stanford University. He is an active member of the U.S.-Ukraine VC industry association, and a spam and content review analyst.

Mykyta will outline the ICO launch process, along with its main difficulties and pitfalls. The significance of ICO launchpads will be emphasized, as well as their advantages and features that help overcome launch challenges.

As it is no secret that ICOs face certain risks and hurdles while in the launch process. ICO launchpads have appeared as a solution to assist and guide the launch of compliant ICOs. Safronenko will explain the opportunities provided by ICO launchpads with regard to exchange listings.

Stay tuned, and don’t miss your chance to find out more about the current challenges of the blockchain economy and the advantages of ICO launchpads. Feel free to contact the Applicature team with any questions!
